items.title: Google partners with Taiwan-based firm for next-gen AI chips
items.summary:
- Google has formed a partnership with a Taiwan-based firm to develop next-generation AI chips.
- This collaboration aims to enhance AI technology for Google's services.
- The specific details regarding chip specifications and expected launch timelines have not been disclosed.

items.title: Indian drone firm DroneAcharya hits record low
items.author: Prateek Srivastava
items.summary:
- Shares of DroneAcharya Aerial Innovations fell by 5% to 61.07 rupees on Mar. 17, marking a record low on the Bombay Stock Exchange.
- The stock price decreased by 40% since its December 2022 listing price of 102 rupees.
- There has been a further drop of 16% over the past month.
- The company, founded in 2017, focuses on drone manufacturing, training, and services.
- DroneAcharya is expanding in India's drone market, projected to exceed US$13 billion by 2030.

items.title: Vietnam’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Startup investments in Vietnam increased more than 3x from US$451 million in 2020 to US$1.4 billion in 2021.
- The number of investment deals also tripled during the same year.
- The article discusses the rise of Vietnam's startup ecosystem and the potential for future investments.

items.title: Crypto funds see record $6.4b outflows over five weeks
items.summary:
- Global crypto investment products experienced US$1.7 billion in net outflows last week, totaling US$6.4 billion over five weeks, according to CoinShares.
- The total assets under management in crypto funds have decreased by US$48 billion from their peak, currently at US$133.6 billion.
- Bitcoin funds led the losses with US$978 million in outflows last week, while Ethereum products faced US$175 million in outflows amid a 10% price drop.
- US investors were responsible for US$1.16 billion of the outflows, whereas Germany, Brazil, Australia, and Hong Kong saw modest inflows.
- Analysts predict potential market stabilization as outflows decreased towards the end of the week, affected by US regulations and economic indicators.

items.title: HR software firm Rippling sues rival for trade secret theft
items.summary:
- Rippling has sued Deel in the US District Court for the Northern District of California for trade secret theft and RICO violations.
- Allegations include hiring an individual ('Deel spy') who accessed Rippling's proprietary records and shared them with Deel executives and a journalist.
- Rippling obtained a court order to preserve data on the spy's phone after discovering these activities, but evidence was allegedly deleted.
- Deel denies the accusations and claims Rippling is diverting attention from its own alleged violations of sanctions laws in Russia.
- Rippling is valued at $13.5 billion, while Deel is valued at $12 billion.

items.title: Chinese service robot output surges 35.7% in early 2025
items.summary:
- China’s service robots production increased by 35.7% to nearly 1.5 million units in early 2025.
- Industrial robot output grew by 27% to 91,088 units during the same period.
- Service robots are now reported as a separate category by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS), highlighting their expanding role.
- Growth in digital product manufacturing rose by 9.1%, influenced by service and industrial robot production.
- The sector includes consumer, professional, and medical robots, with innovations driven by startups like Unitree Robotics and UBTech Robotics.

items.title: Crypto platform Gemini names ex-Morgan Stanley exec as CFO
items.summary:
- Gemini has appointed a former Morgan Stanley executive as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO).
- The decision is part of Gemini's strategy to enhance its leadership team amid a challenging market environment.
- The new CFO is expected to help guide Gemini through regulatory complexities and financial management.

items.title: Delhi to ban non-EV two-wheelers registrations from 2026
items.summary:
• Delhi government to ban registration of non-electric two-wheelers starting August 2026 under EV Policy 2.0.
• Policy aims to phase out fossil fuel-based public transport and replace 10-year-old autorickshaws with EVs.
• By 2027, municipal fleets must be fully electric with 13,200 new charging stations, targeting 95% EV registrations by 2027 and 98% by 2030.

items.title: Swiggy Instamart expands to 100 cities across India
items.summary:
- Swiggy Instamart has expanded to 32 additional cities in 2025, reaching a total of 100 cities in India.
- The initiative includes the launch of 'megapods' that can store up to 50,000 stock-keeping units (SKUs) for better product availability.
- Customers can access over 30,000 products, impacting the company’s financials amid a reported net loss of 799 crore rupees (approx. US$92.1 million) in Q3 FY25, with plans to increase dark stores from 705 to 1,000 by March 2025.

items.title: Zomato faces insolvency case over $188k in unpaid dues
items.summary:
- Zomato is facing an insolvency petition from Nona Lifestyle for unpaid dues of ₹1.64 crore (US$188,933).
- The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) will hear the case on April 3.
- Nona Lifestyle claims Zomato delayed payments for uniforms and ICC World Cup 2023 jerseys ordered in 2023.
- Zomato denies the allegations, stating that the delays were due to Nona’s missed delivery deadlines, leading to penalties.

items.title: Google expands Reddit partnership for AI-powered search
items.summary:
- Alphabet’s Google has expanded its partnership with Reddit by providing access to Google’s Vertex AI, a tool for developing machine learning models.
- This collaboration aims to enhance Reddit’s search functionality by integrating advanced AI capabilities.
- The agreement grants Google real-time access to Reddit’s API, improving the accuracy and relevance of information across Google’s platforms.
- Google stated that the integration would help users find Reddit content more efficiently.

items.title: Intel’s new CEO plots overhaul of manufacturing, AI operations
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lip-Bu Tan appointed as Intel's new CEO effective Mar. 18, 2025.
- Plans to overhaul AI and manufacturing strategies to address existing challenges.
- Emphasis on reducing middle management and revamping the Intel Foundry division.
- Aims to refocus on AI chip production and expand in robotics and foundational AI models.
- Intel stock rose 20% leading up to Tan’s appointment.
- Significant developments include a $1M salary and $66M in stock options for Tan.

items.title: Intel officially appointed Lip-Bu Tan as CEO
items.summary:
- Lip-Bu Tan appointed as Intel's new CEO effective Mar. 18, 2025.
- Tan focuses on overhauling AI and manufacturing strategies to tackle current challenges.
- Plans include streamlining operations by cutting middle management and revamping the Intel Foundry division, which serves clients like Nvidia and Microsoft.
- His strategy emphasizes AI chip production and expanding into robotics and foundational AI sectors.
- Recent developments show Intel stock rose 20% leading up to his appointment with a follow-up 12% jump post-announcement.

items.title: North Korea holds $1.13b in bitcoin
items.summary:
- North Korea is now one of the largest state holders of bitcoin, surpassing Bhutan and El Salvador.
- The Lazarus Group controls approximately 13,518 BTC, valued around US$1.13 billion.
- This increase is connected to the group's US$1.4 billion exploit of the crypto exchange Bybit on February 21, 2023.
- A significant portion of the stolen ether was converted to bitcoin using the decentralized finance platform THORChain.

items.title: Microsoft CEO to visit South Korea for AI, business talks
items.author: Satya Nadella
items.summary:
- Satya Nadella will visit South Korea on Mar. 26, his first trip in over two years.
- He will meet executives from KT Corp., LG Electronics, and HD Hyundai, and deliver a keynote at the Microsoft AI Tour in Seoul.
- Microsoft signed a 5-year, 2.4 trillion won deal with KT Corp. to enhance AI models and cloud services, beginning in September 2024.
- Other tech leaders have visited South Korea recently, indicating the country's rapid AI adoption and strong digital infrastructure.

items.title: Indonesia, Amazon Kuiper partner to bridge digital gaps
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Indonesia's Ministry of Communication is collaborating with Amazon Kuiper to enhance internet access in remote 3T areas.
- Minister Meutya Hafid highlighted the importance of satellite technology in closing digital gaps and the need for new investments.
- Amazon Kuiper is obtaining operational licenses to align with Indonesian regulations for foreign entities.
- The partnership aims to improve the digital ecosystem, benefiting small businesses and enhancing services in government, health, and education.
- Successful implementation could provide millions in 3T areas with better internet access, improving economic opportunities and quality of life.

items.title: Bumble adds ID checks, detects inappropriate messages
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Bumble introduces new ID verification features to enhance user safety.
- The app now has mechanisms to detect inappropriate messages sent between users.
- These measures aim to create a more secure and respectful environment for dating.

items.title: Serverless AI inference platform Featherless raises $5m seed
Quick meals, high costs: inside India’s 10-minute food fight
items.summary:
[India faces a dilemma with rising fast food prices amid a busy lifestyle]
[Consumer preferences are shifting towards quick, affordable meal options]
[The fast food industry in India is at a critical juncture, balancing costs and quality]

items.title: Kazakhstan fintech firm plans $500m bond for acquisitions
items.summary:
- Kaspi.kz JSC, Kazakhstan’s largest publicly traded company, plans to issue its first bond to raise at least US$500 million over five years.
- The company, based in Almaty, provides banking and payment services and has a market capitalization of about US$19 billion.
- Kaspi serves 14 million users in Kazakhstan, which has a population of 20 million, and is seeking international expansion.

items.title: Kazakhstan public company plans $500m bond for acquisitions
items.summary:
- A public company in Kazakhstan is planning to issue a $500 million bond.  
- The funds are intended for acquisitions.  
- This move signals confidence in the local market and business environment.

items.title: India’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article discusses recent trends in startup funding in India.
- It is divided into two sections: a weekly update on investors and macro trends in funding.
- It highlights notable investors and companies active in the region recently.

items.title: Alphabet nearing deal to acquire Wiz for $30b: sources
items.summary:
- Alphabet is in advanced negotiations to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for approximately $30 billion.
- This acquisition would be Alphabet's largest to date if finalized.
- The deal may be completed soon if discussions proceed without issues.
- Wiz previously ended a $23 billion deal with Alphabet last year to focus on its IPO.

items.title: Cyber firm Armis cuts 45 jobs from its $120m acquired startup
items.summary:
- Cybersecurity firm Armis laid off 45 employees from Israeli startup Otorio, over half of its workforce.
- The layoffs followed Armis's US$120 million acquisition of Otorio in March.
- 25 of the affected employees were based in Israel; Otorio is left with 35 development staff.
- The restructuring impacts sales, marketing, finance, and HR departments.
- Otorio, founded in 2018, specializes in cybersecurity for sectors like oil, gas, and manufacturing.
- Otorio's Titan platform will be integrated into Armis’s Centrix suite to boost security for operational technology.
- This acquisition marks Armis's third within a year; the company raised US$200 million in October 2024, reaching a valuation of US$4.3 billion.
- Experts suggest the company may be preparing for an IPO, although Armis has not confirmed this.

items.title: BYD unveils EV platform with 1,000 volt fast charging
items.summary:
- BYD unveils a new EV platform featuring a 1,000-volt architecture for faster charging.
- The platform allows vehicles to travel 400 kilometers after just a five-minute charge.
- The announcement was made at BYD's Shenzhen headquarters, which includes plans for 4,000 ultra-fast charging stations across China.
- Founder Wang Chuanfu highlighted a peak charging speed of 1,000 kilowatts.

items.title: DevOps firm Incredibuild names industry expert Hason as CEO
items.summary:
- Incredibuild appoints Shimon Hason as new CEO, succeeding Tami Mazel Shachar.
- Shachar remains on the board after five years in the role.
- Hason has over two decades of experience in the DevOps sector.
- Previously served as Corporate Development Lead at Datadog and CEO of OzCode, now part of Datadog.
- Founded startup Intigua-JetPatch, currently owned by a private equity firm.

items.title: Recycling startup Cambium nets $28.5m to recycle wood waste
items.summary:
- Cambium, a startup based in Baltimore, has secured US$28.5 million in funding from investors like Volo Earth Ventures and NEA.
- The company focuses on wood recycling to address supply chain challenges and repurpose discarded wood, reducing waste and carbon emissions.
- Major companies, including Amazon and CBRE, have shown interest in Cambium.

items.title: Indian AI startup Unikon.ai shifts to D2C due to high cash burn
items.author: Aakash Anand
items.summary:
- Unikon.ai, co-founded by Aakash Anand in 2024, is shifting its business strategy due to high cash burn, with monthly expenses reaching 2 crore rupee (US$230,758).
- Anand announced that achieving profitability may take considerable time.
- The startup was initially an AI-powered networking platform connecting users with industry experts and educators.
- The company plans to transition into a direct-to-consumer (D2C) brand, leveraging Anand's past success in making D2C businesses profitable.
- In June 2024, Unikon.ai secured 16 crore rupee (US$2 million) in seed funding from investors like Zerodha’s Nikhil Kamath and Lenskart’s Peyush Bansal.
- This pivot emphasizes the company’s focus on a sustainable and profitable business model.

items.title: Singapore’s billion-dollar IPs are ready to be commercialized. What now?
items.author: Candice Lee
items.summary:
- Singapore has a strong history of intellectual properties dating back to the 1980s.
- The city-state is prepared to capitalize on significant investments in deep science and technology.
- There are questions regarding Singapore's ability to transition from research to successful entrepreneurial commercialization.

items.title: Sequoia-backed defense tech startup officially launches
items.author: Hamutal Meridor, Alon Dror, Jason Manne, Omer Bar-Ilan
items.summary:
- Kela Technologies, an Israeli defense tech startup, has launched after raising US$39 million.
- Funding includes a US$11 million seed round led by Sequoia and a US$28 million series A round led by Lux Capital.
- Kela's platform integrates AI models and sensors into military systems for real-time data processing and operational control.
- Initially deploying in Israel, the company aims to expand into US and other Western defense markets.

items.title: Israeli drone maker NextVision bags $63m
items.summary:
• A foreign investment bank acquired a 2.5% stake in NextVision for $52 million.
• Clal insurance company purchased $11 million in shares, increasing its stake to 6.5%.
• The total funding generated from these transactions is $63 million, with shares sold at $24.17 each.
• Co-founder Chen Golan sold $15 million worth of shares, lowering his stake to 5.7%.
• NextVision's revenues in 2024 reached $115 million, a 120% increase from 2023, with a net profit of $66.5 million.

items.title: Alibaba’s AI assistant Quark gains praise in AI race
items.summary:
- Alibaba launched its AI assistant, Quark, on Mar. 13, 2025.
- Quark is powered by the Qwen reasoning AI model and adapts to user intent automatically.
- The assistant received positive reviews in China, especially for its efficiency in answering cosmology questions.
- Quark competes with AI agents like Butterfly Effect’s Manus and OpenAI’s Deep Research.

items.title: Indian home finance startup Nivara nets $28m series B
Zoom upgrades AI assistant with new productivity tools
Klarna, OnePay partner for Walmart installment loans
Google to shift G Suite free accounts to pooled storage
Telegram founder Durov returns to Dubai after France ban
Gojek co-founder, Y Combinator invest in Mito Health
items.summary:
- Mito Health, a Singapore-based healthtech startup, has raised an additional US$2.2 million in seed funding.
- New investors include Y Combinator and XA Network, alongside notable angel investors like Gojek co-founder Kevin Aluwi and others.
- Total funding raised by Mito Health now amounts to US$4 million, with plans to expand operations in the US market.
- Mito Health provides comprehensive blood testing services analyzing over 100 biomarkers to build health profiles for clients.
- The company established partnerships with Labcorp to leverage US laboratory services and intends to expand collaborations with various health and wellness sectors.

items.title: WeLab Bank cracked Hong Kong. Now it’s taking on Southeast Asia
items.author: Simon Loong
items.summary:
- WeLab Bank reached monthly breakeven in December 2024, four years post-launch.
- Its breakeven time frame is longer than competitors like KakaoBank and WeBank.
- Loong, CEO, highlights that only 16 out of 45 digital banks in Asia have achieved breakeven.
- WeLab Bank aims to expand into Southeast Asia, having launched Bank Saqu in Indonesia.
- Plans for a similar launch in Thailand are underway, focusing on profitability in 3-5 years.
- The bank operates without backing from major conglomerates unlike some rivals.

items.title: Mistral AI expands in APAC with new VP hire
items.author: Geoff Soon
items.summary:
- Mistral AI appoints Geoff Soon as Vice President of Revenue for the APAC region.
- Aimed at strengthening the company's presence in the APAC market.
- The company intends to invest in resources and efforts within the region.

items.title: Taiwan stocks rise ahead of Nvidia’s conference
items.summary:
- The Taiwan stock market closed up on March 17, supported by AI-related shares.
- The Taiex index increased by 150.58 points (0.69%) to 22,118.63 with a turnover of NT$301.88 billion (US$9.15 billion).
- Electronics shares, particularly Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC), contributed significantly to the gains, rising 1.15% and adding approximately 88 points to the Taiex's total.

items.title: Forrest Li confirms candidacy for SG football chief
items.summary:
- Forrest Li, billionaire and Sea Limited founder, announces candidacy for the presidency of the Football Association of Singapore (FAS).
- Announcement made on March 17; elections scheduled for April 28.
- Li plans to share details about his team and vision for Singapore football soon.
- Former FAS council member from 2017 to 2021; oversaw the privatization of the Lion City Sailors in 2020.

items.title: Catcha Digital unit to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion
items.summary:
- Catcha Digital, through its subsidiary iMedia Asia, plans to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion Studio for 37.32 million ringgit (around US$8.39 million) in cash.
- The acquisition involves purchasing 600,000 shares of Framemotion, a digital media advertising solutions provider.
- Framemotion is expected to achieve a profit after tax of at least 6.8 million ringgit (around US$1.5 million) in the first year post-acquisition.
- A similar profit target is set for the following year as well. 
- The deal aims to leverage Catcha Digital’s digital advertising expertise with Framemotion’s strengths in virtual and augmented reality content.

items.title: SG’s Creative Technology lays off 14% of its employees
items.summary:
- Creative Technology, based in Singapore, has laid off about 40 employees, which is 14% of its workforce.
- Affected departments included sales and marketing.
- The company currently has over 280 employees, a significant reduction from its numbers in the early 2000s.
- Creative reported a net loss of US$6.1 million for the first half of its fiscal year ending Dec. 31, 2024, up from a loss of US$4.1 million the previous year.
- Despite an 18% increase in net sales to US$37.4 million, financial challenges persist, attributed to market decline.
- The company is in search of a new CEO following Song Siow Hui's retirement in February 2025, after the death of founder Sim Wong Hoo in January 2023.

items.title: A deepening economic crisis in Indonesia
items.summary:
- In 2024, Indonesia experienced a 20.2% surge in mass layoffs, totaling 78,000 jobs lost.
- The manufacturing sector, crucial to the economy, saw its GDP contribution drop from 32% in 2002 to 18% in 2024.
- Experts warn of premature deindustrialization, potentially degrading household purchasing power.
- Analysts suggest urgent fiscal and monetary incentives are needed to stabilize the economy.

items.title: 20 top angel investment networks in Asia
items.summary:
- The article discusses the rise of angel investment networks in Asia amid a growing number of high-net-worth individuals seeking to diversify investments.
- Individual investments in startups can be risky, leading to increased interest in joining syndicates.
- Angel investment networks help mitigate risks, improve access to deals, and allow investors to engage with a broader range of startups.
- The article focuses on data from the past two years to ensure relevance and accuracy in listing these networks.

items.title: Apple to review AI issues at key offsite meeting
items.summary:
- Apple executives will discuss AI strategy at the annual Top 100 offsite meeting this week.
- The meeting comes amidst delays and criticisms of Apple Intelligence, launched in June 2024.
- Upgrades to Siri have been delayed indefinitely despite earlier promises of improvements.
- Related news includes: Apple aiming for a portless iPhone 17 Air and facing competition issues with iPhone 16e.

items.title: Japan-based tech startup creates 1st AI peer-reviewed paper
items.summary:
- A Japan-based tech startup has produced the first AI-generated paper that went through a peer-review process.
- This milestone showcases the advancements of AI in the field of academic publishing.
- The article discusses the implications of AI in research and how it might change the future of academic contributions.

items.title: South Korea’s chip exports drop 31.8% due to US-China tensions
items.summary:
- South Korea’s semiconductor exports to China fell by 31.8% in February 2025 compared to February 2024.
- The decline raises concerns about weakening global demand and US restrictions on technology exports to China.
- This drop is steeper than the 22.5% decrease noted in January 2025.
- The downturn follows a recovery in 2024 that had previously positively impacted South Korea’s economy.
- The decline is linked to new US export controls limiting China’s access to advanced semiconductor technologies.

items.title: Ola Electric shares hit record low after insolvency petition
items.summary:
- Shares of Ola Electric Mobility dropped 3.9% on Mar. 17, reaching 48.53 rupees (US$0.558).
- The decline followed an insolvency petition filed by Rosmerta Digital Services against one of its subsidiaries.
- The petition alleges non-fulfillment of payment obligations by Ola Electric Technologies, disclosed in an exchange filing on Mar. 15.
